latestAction.text: Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 569.

item.latestTitle: Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2016

latestAction.text: Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 2822 as unfinished business.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 244 - 178 (Roll no. 380). (text: CR H4608)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 244 - 178 (Roll no. 380).(text: CR H4608)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 181 (Roll no. 379). (consideration: CR H4614-4615; text: CR H4614-4615)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 333.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H4608-4617)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 44.
Resolution provides for a modified open rule for H.R. 2822; a structured rule for H.R. 2042; and provides for proceedings of the House during the period from June 26, 2015, through July 6, 2015.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-177, by Mr. Burgess.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-177, by Mr. Burgess.

Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2822) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2016, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2042) to allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing carbon dioxide emissions from existing fossil fuel-fired electric utility generating units before requiring compliance with such rule, and to allow States to protect households and businesses from significant adverse effects on electricity ratepayers or reliability; and providing for proceedings during the period from June 26, 2015, through July 6, 2015.
item.name: Introduced in House

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
